yueluo.title: Yueluo Children's Book Club
yueluo.subtitle: Yueluo Children's Book Club
yueluo.description: Reshaping the family reading experience for children aged 3-6 through digital companionship and intelligent recommendations.
yueluo.hero_card_text: In a WeChat Mini Program with 40,000+ borrows, as the core frontend engineer, I solved the pain points of parents' "difficulty in choosing books" and children's "inability to understand" by building smooth audio interactions and personalized borrowing flows.
yueluo.challenge_heading: More than just borrowing, it's companionship
yueluo.challenge_text_1: In the fast-paced modern life, Chinese parents attach great importance to children's early reading, but face two main pain points:
yueluo.challenge_point_1_desc: Facing a massive number of picture books, parents don't know what suits their child's age and interests (such as emotional management, understanding the body, etc.).
yueluo.challenge_point_2_desc: Parents don't always know how to tell stories vividly, leading to children losing interest in static paper books.
yueluo.challenge_mission: My Mission: To build a high-fidelity WeChat Mini Program that not only achieves e-commerce level borrowing smoothness but also seamlessly connects physical books with digital audio through the "Audio Companion" feature, creating an immersive reading environment.
yueluo.feature_1_desc: Picture book reading is visual, but to maintain children's attention, we need to introduce auditory elements. How to provide smooth audio control without interfering with the browsing experience?
yueluo.feature_1_point_1_desc: I designed a global audio player component. Whether the user is browsing the book list or checking the borrowing status, audio playback will not be interrupted. This simulates the continuity of parents telling stories in their ears.
yueluo.feature_1_point_2_desc: In detail pages like "The Giant Panda in the Bamboo Forest 2", users can click "Start Trial Listening" and get immediate feedback. I optimized the preloading logic of audio resources to minimize delay, ensuring children won't be distracted by waiting.
yueluo.feature_1_point_3_desc: The text on the picture book companion page uses word-by-word highlighting following the audio, which can capture children's attention and prevent distraction. At the same time, for children in the literacy stage, this method is analogous to finger reading, helping children's initial independent reading.
yueluo.feature_2_desc: The reading needs of 3-year-olds and 6-year-olds are completely different. If the homepage content is irrelevant, parents will quickly churn.
yueluo.feature_2_point_1_desc: Based on the birth date and growth concerns (such as "emotional management" or "social relationships") entered by the user, I built a dynamic tag filtering system.
yueluo.feature_2_point_2_desc: On the homepage, I implemented dynamic rendering logic based on user tags. If a parent chooses "Understanding the Body", the system will prioritize displaying relevant books like "Mom's Belly Button", reducing the cognitive load of user search.
yueluo.feature_3_desc: The core of borrowing service is "order pooling". Users need to pool 5 books to reach the borrowing threshold or optimal shipping fee, which is usually a tedious process of repeated jumping.
yueluo.feature_3_point_1_desc: I developed a bottom Floating Action Bar, displaying "Currently 0 books, can add 5 more" in real-time. Using React's reactive features, when users add books on any list page, the bottom status bar will update instantly with micro-animations, giving users clear visual feedback.
yueluo.feature_3_point_2_desc: To assist decision-making, clicking the book cover enters an immersive preview mode, supporting gesture zooming and sliding, highly restoring the texture of paper books.
yueluo.technical_desc: As a WeChat Mini Program, due to the package size limit (2MB), maintaining high-quality image display while ensuring smoothness is a huge challenge.
yueluo.technical_point_1_desc: To prevent white screen anxiety, I implemented a custom Skeleton Screen loading strategy, especially in multi-image grid layouts, improving Perceived Performance.
yueluo.technical_point_2_desc: Considering the instability of mobile networks, I wrote local caching logic to record users' playback progress, ensuring that they can "resume listening" when opening the mini-program again.
yueluo.reflection_text_1: This project made me realize that frontend development is not just about restoring design drafts, but about "building connections". In this case, my code connected:
yueluo.reflection_point_1: Physical World & Digital World: Paper book borrowing and digital audio playback.
yueluo.reflection_point_2: Parents & Children: Helping parents understand their children's current growth needs through personalized tags.
yueluo.reflection_text_2: I hope to further explore how to assist children's education through multimodal interaction (not just screen clicks, but also voice, gestures, etc.) to make technology warmer.

yimireading.title: Yi Mi Reading
yimireading.subtitle: Transforming boring K-12 reading into an adventurous interactive journey
yimireading.description: On a reading platform serving elementary and middle school students, I worked with product design colleagues to build an immersive learning system containing map breakthroughs, virtual economy, and social PK using gamification design concepts and high-interaction frontend technology, significantly improving students' reading completion rates.
yimireading.hero_card_text: Our goal is not simply to move books online, but to build a 'Reading Amusement Park' where children actively read to earn rewards, upgrade equipment, and explore maps.
yimireading.contribution_value: Gamified Map Development, Virtual Asset Interaction System, Multimedia Learning Modules
yimireading.challenge_text_1: For upper elementary students (like the 6th-grade user shown in the screenshot), reading is often seen as a mandatory homework assignment.
yimireading.challenge_point_1_desc: Finishing a book takes a long time, making it hard for students to feel a sense of achievement.
yimireading.challenge_point_2_desc: Traditional text reading struggles to attract the attention of 'digital natives' through digital screens.
yimireading.challenge_mission: My Mission: As a frontend engineer, I need to visualize the 'incentive mechanisms' in educational psychology through technical means. My goal is not simply to move books online, but to build a 'Reading Amusement Park'.
yimireading.feature_1_title: Visualized Progress Metaphor: Map Breakthrough System
yimireading.feature_1_desc: Instead of giving children a boring 'task list', give them a 'treasure map'.
yimireading.feature_1_point_1_desc: I developed a high-performance visual map. Users are no longer clicking lists, but 'sailing' on winding rivers.
yimireading.feature_1_point_2_desc: Each level has three states: locked, in progress, and completed. When a user completes a reading task, the node on the map unlocks with particle effects, giving a strong visual reward.
yimireading.feature_1_point_3_desc: The map contains a large number of animated elements. I used virtual scrolling technology to ensure a smooth 60fps sliding experience even on low-end student phones.
yimireading.feature_2_desc: According to the Hook Model, variable rewards are key to retention.
yimireading.feature_2_point_1_desc: I built the 'Rice Coin' animation system. When students complete 'Reading Treasure Hunt' or 'Daily Check-in', gold coins are not just a change in numbers, but fly into the wallet through parabolic animation, enhancing the sense of gain.
yimireading.feature_2_point_2_desc: The frontend uses layered rendering technology to allow users to preview avatar frames, dynamic cards, and character combinations in real-time. This satisfies the social display desire and self-identity of children of this age.
yimireading.feature_3_desc: To reduce the cognitive load of pure text reading, we need to mobilize multiple senses.
yimireading.feature_3_point_1_desc: In the 'Beautiful Text Listening' and 'Classic Recitation' modules, I implemented real-time synchronization of audio playback and text highlighting. This is crucial for language learners as it establishes a direct mapping between vision and hearing.
yimireading.feature_3_point_2_desc: For the 'Reading Treasure Hunt' feature, my colleague integrated the browser/native recording API and implemented real-time waveform visualization, allowing children to see their voices being 'recorded' and 'scored', increasing the fun of interaction.
yimireading.feature_4_desc: Create exclusive social personas and interactive spaces to enhance user belonging and activity.
yimireading.feature_4_point_1_desc: The frontend uses layered rendering technology to allow users to preview avatar frames, dynamic cards, and character combinations in real-time. This satisfies the social display desire and self-identity of children of this age.
yimireading.feature_4_point_2_desc: Here you can publish your own reading reflections and interesting life events, and also see the dynamics of classmates. It is a small social world.
yimireading.technical_desc: This is a heavy interaction application containing complex animations, audio streams, and real-time social networking. How to ensure stability on educational hardware (usually with lower configuration)?
yimireading.technical_point_1_desc: For pages containing a large number of dynamic cards (GIF/WebP), I designed a priority loading queue to ensure that core interaction elements are rendered first.
yimireading.technical_point_2_desc: User reading progress, Rice Coin quantity, and backpack equipment need to be synchronized globally. I used a single source of truth to ensure that gold coins obtained on the 'Map' page are instantly available on the 'Mall' page, without any sense of experience fragmentation caused by data delay.
yimireading.reflection_text_1: The 'Yi Mi Reading' project gave me a deep understanding of the power of Persuasive Technology. As a frontend developer, I used to focus on 'how fast the page renders', now I focus more on 'how interaction design drives behavior'.
yimireading.reflection_point_1: Extrinsic Incentive System: In this project, I used code to build an extrinsic incentive system (Extrinsic Motivation) to help students overcome the initial resistance to reading.
yimireading.reflection_point_2: From Extrinsic to Intrinsic: I hope to further study: how to smoothly transition from 'extrinsic incentives' (earning Rice Coins) to 'intrinsic incentives' (truly falling in love with reading), so that technology can not only attract attention but also cultivate long-term habits.

cloud_chinese.title: Cloud Chinese
cloud_chinese.subtitle: The Digital Link for Global Chinese Education: A Cross-Time Zone Cultural Collaboration Platform
cloud_chinese.description: Through data visualization and live streaming technology, we built an online ecosystem connecting Chinese schools in 50+ countries, allowing teachers and students thousands of miles apart to collaborate 'hand in hand' and share cultural resources.
cloud_chinese.hero_card_text: My task is to visualize the abstract 'global network'. This is not just an information portal, but a digital square where teachers in Montreal and teachers in Guangxi can interact in real-time in a virtual space.
cloud_chinese.challenge_text_1: There are thousands of Chinese schools scattered around the world, often isolated and lacking channels for resource sharing.
cloud_chinese.challenge_point_1_desc: The cooperative relationship between schools is abstract, and it is difficult for users to perceive the existence of a 'global community'.
cloud_chinese.challenge_point_2_desc: Users are all over the world, and the network environment varies. How to ensure the smoothness of large-scale event live broadcasts (such as recitation contests)?
cloud_chinese.challenge_mission: My Mission: To visualize the abstract 'global network'. I am not just making an information portal, but building a digital square.
cloud_chinese.feature_1_desc: 'A bosom friend afar brings a distant land near' cannot be just a slogan. HCI research shows that visualized social connections can significantly enhance users' Sense of Belonging.
cloud_chinese.feature_1_point_1_desc: I didn't use static images, but used CSS animation to create a rotating earth, allowing users to perceive the existence of global links.
cloud_chinese.feature_1_point_2_desc: Schools that have established a 'hand-in-hand' relationship are displayed on the same connection line. This feedback intuitively interprets the concept of 'Hand in Hand'.
cloud_chinese.feature_2_desc: Global time difference is the biggest obstacle. We need to provide a seamless experience that allows both 'real-time participation' and 'anytime playback'.
cloud_chinese.feature_2_point_1_desc: For high-traffic events such as 'Recitation Contests', I referenced a player based on the HLS protocol, supporting Adaptive Bitrate (ABR).
cloud_chinese.feature_2_point_2_desc: In the live broadcast list, I designed clear status indicators (Starting/Playback) and pushed real-time status updates via WebSocket to reduce invalid clicks by users.
cloud_chinese.feature_3_desc: User Generated Content (UGC) is the source of community vitality. How to display dozens of event photos on one page without lagging?
cloud_chinese.feature_3_point_1_desc: For the grid/multi-image updates published by schools, I adopted a Masonry-like layout algorithm to adapt to images of different sizes.
cloud_chinese.feature_3_point_2_desc: Implemented a Lazy Loading strategy based on Intersection Observer. Image resources only start loading when the user scrolls to the current update. This not only saves bandwidth but also ensures the First Contentful Paint (FCP) speed for users around the world.
cloud_chinese.technical_desc: In this project, the biggest challenge was the balance between compatibility and performance. To serve global users (including those with older devices), I did not use overly aggressive CSS features, but adopted a Graceful Degradation strategy.
cloud_chinese.reflection_text_1: 'Cloud Chinese' made me think about the mediating role of technology in cultural transmission. If the previous children's book APP focused on 'individual' experience, then this project focuses on 'group' connection.
cloud_chinese.reflection_point_1: Bridge for Cross-Cultural Communication: Seeing Canadian students upload their recitation videos through the function I developed, I realized that frontend code is not just a pile of logic, but a bridge for cross-cultural communication.
cloud_chinese.reflection_point_2: Inclusive Design: I want to explore how to design more inclusive digital interfaces to connect people from different cultural backgrounds.

yimi_teacher.title: Yi Mi Reading Teacher Web
yimi_teacher.subtitle: Liberating teachers from tedious lesson preparation: Building a one-stop digital hub for K-9 Chinese teaching.
yimi_teacher.description: Addressing the pain points of 'hard-to-find lesson preparation resources' and 'fragmented teaching research time' for primary and middle school Chinese teachers, we developed a SaaS platform integrating resource retrieval, online document preview, and live teaching research, serving the daily teaching workflow of tens of thousands of frontline teachers.
yimi_teacher.hero_card_text: My task is to build an efficient productivity tool. Unlike the 'fun' of the student end, the interaction design of the teacher end must follow the 'shortest path principle' - allowing teachers to find and confirm resources for any lesson within 3 clicks.
yimi_teacher.contribution_value: Complex Information Architecture Implementation, Online Document Rendering, Third-party Live Streaming Integration
yimi_teacher.timeline_value: Task Efficiency, Information Architecture, Cognitive Load Reduction
yimi_teacher.challenge_text_1: In China, a Chinese teacher spends an average of more than 1 hour a day looking for courseware and lesson plans.
yimi_teacher.challenge_point_1_desc: High-quality teaching resources are scattered in various forums and network drives, with extremely low retrieval efficiency.
yimi_teacher.challenge_point_2_desc: In the traditional mode, teachers must download huge compressed packages first, and then unzip them to check whether the content is applicable, resulting in high trial and error costs.
yimi_teacher.challenge_mission: My Mission: To build an efficient productivity tool. Let teachers find and confirm resources for any lesson within 3 clicks.
yimi_teacher.feature_1_desc: To reduce cognitive load, I did not use a traditional search box, but designed a visualized 'Textbook Matrix'.
yimi_teacher.feature_1_point_1_desc: I implemented a four-level linkage filter based on Grade -> Volume -> Unit -> Resource Type. Using React state management, when the user switches any dimension, the resource list below updates in milliseconds without refreshing.
yimi_teacher.feature_1_point_2_desc: I used highlighted color blocks (orange) to clearly indicate the current filtering path, preventing users from getting lost in the complex textbook system.
yimi_teacher.feature_2_desc: Decision-making upfront. Letting teachers clearly see every detail of the content before downloading is the key to improving efficiency.
yimi_teacher.feature_2_point_1_desc: For the complex 'Unit Integrated Learning Map', I integrated PDF.js and customized it deeply. It supports vector-level scaling and lazy loading rendering on the browser side, so even 50MB high-definition lesson plans can be opened in seconds without waiting for download.
yimi_teacher.feature_2_point_2_desc: No matter where the user scrolls in the document, the download button is always visible, complying with Fitt's Law and shortening the operation distance.
yimi_teacher.feature_3_desc: How to let busy teachers use fragmented time for professional development?
yimi_teacher.feature_3_point_1_desc: For famous teacher live broadcasts, I developed a live stream player. The frontend automatically detects the stream status, seamlessly converts to VOD (Video on Demand) mode after the live broadcast ends, and retains the chat room history to create a 'sense of presence'.
yimi_teacher.feature_3_point_2_title: Card Layout for Teaching Research Content
yimi_teacher.feature_3_point_2_desc: I used a card design to display video streams, with each card clearly marking the activity status (such as 'Replay'), helping teachers quickly filter lectures of interest.
yimi_teacher.technical_desc: User research found that the configuration of office computers in many schools is still low, and screen resolutions vary.
yimi_teacher.technical_point_1_desc: Although it is a PC web page, I made special CSS Grid adaptations for old resolutions like 1024x768 to ensure that filter buttons are not misaligned.
yimi_teacher.technical_point_2_desc: Considering the bandwidth limitations of the campus network, in the 'One-click Download All Resources' function, I implemented backend streaming packaging and frontend chunked download logic to prevent large files from causing browser crashes.
yimi_teacher.reflection_text_1: This project showcases another side of me as an engineer: the pursuit of instrumental rationality. If the student end is designing 'experience', then the teacher end is designing 'efficiency'.
yimi_teacher.reflection_point_1: Creating Time for Teachers: By optimizing the presentation and access path of information through frontend technology, I am actually 'creating time' for teachers.
yimi_teacher.reflection_point_2: Empathy in B2B Products: Even for B2B efficiency tools, 'empathy' is core. Only by truly understanding the anxiety of teachers preparing lessons late at night can we design a truly easy-to-use interface.
